thread.title: Map: Find the Country's A-Plus Schools for B Students
thread.title_full: Map: Find the Country's A-Plus Schools for B Students - US News

author: USNews
title: Map: Find the Country's A-Plus Schools for B Students
text:
Map: Find the Country's A-Plus Schools for B Students Students who aren't at the top of their high school classes can explore these colleges as they look for the right fit. By Travis Mitchell Oct. 15, 2015 | 8:30 a.m. EDT + More Putting together college applications can be stressful for even the most accomplished students, especially with competition on the rise . For those who have struggled with their SAT or ACT scores or haven’t earned straight A’s, the pressure to impress admissions officials can cause even more anxiety.
To help high school students who have strong academic transcripts but who aren’t at the top of their classes, U.S. News calculates a specialty list of A-plus Schools for B Students as part of the annual Best Colleges rankings. The list includes schools that perform well in the rankings and that admit students who don’t have perfect grades or test scores.
U.S. News first evaluated schools' performance in the 2016 Best Colleges rankings, as well as their average freshman retention rate and incoming students' SAT or ACT scores. Finally, each school on the list couldn't have more than 50 percent of its freshmen come from the top 10 percent of their high school classes.
The following map showcases the 50 highest-ranked schools from the National Universities and National Liberal Arts Colleges categories that made the list of A-plus Schools for B Students, including ties. The rank shown for each school reflects its placement in the 2016 Best Colleges rankings. More schools can be found on the full lists , along with information on schools that placed in the Regional Universities and Regional Colleges categories.
Searching for a college? Get our complete rankings of Best Colleges.
TAGS: colleges college admissions SAT students education high school rankings
